intro: Herniaria corrigioloides, commonly known as the rock crassworts, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to rocky and coastal areas of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils and is often found in maritime environments. Its ability to tolerate salt spray and harsh coastal conditions makes it a hardy species. Herniaria corrigioloides is also notable for its unique reproductive structures and its role in stabilizing rocky habitats.
